page.title: 06LANDSCAPE WESTPORT LAKE
page.content: Westport Lake used to be the site of Port Vale football club,then the ground sunk and became a tip and was polluted. Today there are two lakes,with a path a mile long around them.A lot of people use the lake,they go fishing and sailing.You can walk around the lake.By it there is a small nature reserve,with many types of wildlife there.You have to be careful because it is like a swamp.There is a little lake which is a bird sanctuary,with a little island for birds to nest.On the car park there is a snack-bar in the Summer,and there are also some toilets.The lake has many visitors both in Summer and in Winter. A rubbish tip is now a public park in Stoke-on-Trent.
